snippet: President Obama and House Republicans failed to reach agreement on a short extension of the nation’s borrowing authority during a White House meeting, but both sides agreed to keep talking.
abstract: President Obama and House Republicans fail to reach agreement on six-week extension of the nation’s borrowing authority during a White House meeting, but both sides keep talking; offer from politically besieged Republicans is seen as shift in tone and initial step toward ending budget standoff.

byline.original: By JACKIE CALMES and ASHLEY PARKER
byline.contributor: Jeremy W. Peters and Annie Lowrey contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: President Obama and House Republicans failed to reach agreement on a short extension of the nation’s borrowing authority during a White House meeting, but both sides agreed to keep talking.

headline.main: No Quick Deal, but Offer by G.O.P. on Debt Shifts the Tone
headline.print_headline: Talks Are Begun On Fiscal Crisis; No Quick Accord
